Accessibility Issues From People Who Know

02 Jun 1999

The UK's Royal National Institute for the Blind have this article on producing designs for visually impaired people.

\n

It's interesting on 2 counts:

\n
    \n
  1. It's written by an actual disability organisation (rather than a 3rd party)\n
  2. It has information on how HTML readers for visually impaired people (I guess this means braille and/or speech) render (or rather don't) render frames and image maps.\n
